title: Rita Ora cuts a casual figure as she films scenes for modern remake of Oliver! in London
text:
She has previously graced the screen in films including Fifty Shades of Grey and Southpaw.

And Rita Ora looked ready to get to work as she filmed scenes for her new movie Twist, a modern retelling of Oliver Twist, in London on Tuesday.

The singer, 28, who plays the Artful Dodger in the flick which stars Rafferty Law in the main role, cut a casual figure for the day on set where she styled her locks into intricate braids.

On location: Rita Ora, 28, filmed scenes for her new movie Twist, a modern retelling of Oliver Twist, in London on Tuesday

Rita donned a black jacket with a multi-coloured print and a beaded embellishment on the shoulders which she paired with a grey hoodie.

The Hot Right Now hitmaker also sported grey tracksuit bottoms along with white and green trainers.

In another look, Rita wore a knee-length black jacket along with baggy black trousers and a matching pair of boots.

The former American's Next Top Model host completed her second look with a leopard print top and hoop earrings.

Laid back: The singer who plays the Artful Dodger in the flick which stars Rafferty Law in the main role, cut a casual figure for the day on set where she styled her locks into braids

For her part, pop star Rita was recently seen getting mischievous with her co-star as she dressed up in police uniform.

Before switching ensembles, the singer donned a blonde wig styled in a bob, as well as a camouflage coat and a red checked scarf.

The stars' sighting comes days after MailOnline revealed Rafferty had landed the lead role in the re-imagining of Charles Dickens' enduring classic.

Style: Rita donned a black jacket with a multi-coloured print and a beaded embellishment on the shoulders which she paired with a grey hoodie

With Rita cast as the Artful Dodger, comedian David Walliams, 48, will play Losberne and Sir Michael Caine, 86, takes on the iconic role of Fagin.

A source close to the project said: 'Shooting for the new film starts today and everyone is very excited to get started.

'Twist is a modern interpretation of Charles Dickens’ Oliver in which the title character has been reinvented as a streetwise artist living on the streets of modern-day London.

'Rafferty impressed with his screen presence and his edginess brings a whole new dimension to the role of Oliver.

Outfit: In another look, Rita wore a knee-length black jacket along with baggy black trousers and a matching pair of boots

'It’s an all-star cast with David in the mix after arriving at today's first rehearsal – not to mention Rita and Sir Michael Caine.'

In the new film, Oliver and Dodger get caught up in a heist to steal a priceless painting for master thief, Fagin.

On playing the villainous character, Sir Michael Caine said: 'Fagin is such an infamous character, it’s going to be great fun playing him.

In character: Rita recently filmed scenes for Twist opposite Rafferty Law where she donned a police uniform

'I’m really looking forward to working with Lena, Raff and the rest of the cast in London when we start shooting.'

Game Of Thrones star Lena Headey plays Sikes, who's been described as 'Fagin's psychopathic business partner,' in the original film directed by Martin Owen.

Rafferty added: 'I’m excited to play such a well-loved literary character.

'I’m looking forward to working with Martin Owen to bring to life his new take on the character in modern-day London.'
description: The singer, 28, looked ready to get to work as she filmed scenes for her new movie Twist, a modern retelling of Oliver Twist, in London on Tuesday.
